intro: Euphrasia pubescens, commonly known as the downy eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are opposite and have a glandular surface, while its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. Euphrasia pubescens is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
